intro: Hesperevax acaulis, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the early morning, followed by fluffy seed heads that disperse its seeds by the wind. Hesperevax acaulis typically grows close to the ground, forming dense mats that help prevent soil erosion. Its botanical features make it well adapted to extreme climates and a valuable component of its ecosystem.
